thread.title: Most Connected Hospitals 2015-16 Results
thread.title_full: Most Connected Hospitals 2015-16 Results - US News

author: USNews
title: Most Connected Hospitals 2015-16 Results
text:
Most Connected Hospitals 2015-16 Results These 159 medical centers have shown a commitment to use digital data in key aspects of patient care. By U.S. News Staff Oct. 15, 2015 | 5:59 p.m. EDT
+ More U.S. News & World Report’s Most Connected Hospitals 2015-16 recognizes 159 medical centers that have made noteworthy strides to embrace digital technology in health care. The centers had to demonstrate ability to share data with providers within and outside their walls, improve patient safety through computerization and engage patients in their own care by providing them with electronic access to their own medical information.
Recognition was based on points awarded for hospitals’ responses to selected questions from the 2013 and 2014 American Hospital Association Annual Survey Information Technology Supplements. To achieve Most Connected status, a hospital had to score at least 70 out of a total of 75 points in 2014 or 55 out of a total of 61 points in 2013.
Initial eligibility required hospitals first to have been nationally ranked or rated as high performing by U.S. News in 2015-16 in Best Hospitals (for complex care ), Best Hospitals for Common Care or Best Children’s Hospitals .
The methodology is summarized following the list of Most Connected Hospitals. More detail is available as a downloadable PDF . The Most Connected Hospitals list below is ordered alphabetically within each state.
